questions.answer: This computer bug was discovered in 1947 when a moth got stuck in a Harvard Mark II computer relay, giving us the term 'debugging'
questions.question: What was the first computer bug?

questions.answer: This British mathematician helped crack the German Enigma code during World War II, laying foundations for modern computing
questions.question: Who was Alan Turing?

questions.answer: This 1988 self-replicating computer program infected 6,000 Unix systems and demanded payment, pioneering digital extortion
questions.question: What was the Morris Worm?

questions.answer: This whistleblower leaked classified NSA documents in 2013, exposing global surveillance programs and inspiring the term 'going dark'
questions.question: Who was Edward Snowden?

questions.answer: This early hacker collective, formed in the 1980s, combined technical expertise with political activism and social consciousness
questions.question: Who were the Legion of Doom?
